net.openhft.chronicle.hash.serialization.internal

Class ByteableMarshaller<E extends Byteable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.openhft.chronicle.hash.serialization.internal.ByteableMarshaller<E>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, BytesInterop<E>, BytesReader<E>, BytesWriter<E>, DeserializationFactoryConfigurableBytesReader<E,ByteableMarshaller<E>>, MetaBytesInterop<E,Object>, MetaBytesWriter<E,Object>, SizeMarshaller

    public abstract class ByteableMarshaller<E extends Byteable>
extends Object
implements BytesInterop<E>, MetaBytesInterop<E,Object>, DeserializationFactoryConfigurableBytesReader<E,ByteableMarshaller<E>>, SizeMarshaller
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        Description copied from interface: BytesWriter
        Returns the length (in bytes) of the serialized form of the given object. Serialization form in terms of this interface, i. e. how much bytes are written to bytes on write(bytes, e) call.
        Specified by:

      • startsWith

        public boolean startsWith(Bytes bytes,
                 E e)
        Description copied from interface: BytesInterop
        Checks if the given bytes starts (from the bytes' position) with the byte sequence the given object is serialized to, without actual serialization.
        Specified by:
        startsWith in interface BytesInterop<E extends Byteable>
        Parameters:
        bytes - the bytes to check if starts with the serialized form of the given object. bytes' is positioned at the first byte to compare. bytes' limit is unspecified. bytes' position and limit shouldn't be altered during this call.
        e - the object to serialize virtually and compare with the given bytes
        Returns:
        if the given bytes starts with the given e object's serialized form

      • hash

        public long hash(E e)
        Specified by:

      • write

        public void write(Bytes bytes,
         E e)
        Description copied from interface: BytesWriter
        Serializes the given object to the given bytes, without writing the length of the serialized form itself.

        Implementation of this method should increment the bytes' position by size(e). The given object should be written into these range between the initial bytes' position and the position after this method call returns. Implementation of this method must not alter the bytes' limit and contents outside of the specified range.

        Specified by:
        write in interface BytesWriter<E extends Byteable>
        Parameters:
        bytes - the Bytes to write the given object to
        e - the object to serialize to the given bytes
        See Also:
        BytesReader.read(Bytes, long)

      • readSize

        public long readSize(Bytes bytes)
        Specified by:
        readSize in interface SizeMarshaller

      • read

        public E read(Bytes bytes,
     long size)
        Description copied from interface: BytesReader
        Reads and returns the object from [position(), position() + size] bytes of the given Bytes.

        Implementation of this method should increment the bytes' position by the given size, i. e. "consume" the bytes of the deserialized object. It must not alter the bytes' limit and contents.

        Specified by:
        read in interface BytesReader<E extends Byteable>
        Parameters:
        bytes - the Bytes to read the object from
        size - the size of the serialized form of the returned object
        Returns:
        the object read from the bytes
        See Also:
        BytesWriter.write(Bytes, Object), BytesReader.read(Bytes, long, Object)

      • read

        public E read(Bytes bytes,
     long size,
     E toReuse)
        Description copied from interface: BytesReader
        Similar to BytesReader.read(Bytes, long), but should attempt to reuse the given object, i. e. to read the deserialized data into the given instance. If it is possible, this objects than returned from this method. If it isn't possible for any reason, a new object should be created and returned, just like in BytesReader.read(Bytes, long) method. The given object could be null, in this case this method should behave exactly the same as BytesReader.read(Bytes, long) method does.
        Specified by:
        read in interface BytesReader<E extends Byteable>
        Parameters:
        bytes - the Bytes to read the object from
        size - the size of the serialized form of the returned object
        toReuse - the object to read the deserialized data into
        Returns:
        the object read from the bytes, either reused or newly created
        See Also:
        BytesReader.read(Bytes, long)
